translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Twelve
The Elder Nun Uppalavaṇṇā
“Both mother and daughter,
we were enemies to each other.
I was overcome with anxiety,
astonished, my hair standing on end.
Shame on sensual desires, impure,
foul-smelling, with many thorns,
where mother and daughter,

analyzed: sabhariyā mayam ahu  kāmesva ādīnavam disvā
translated: we were rivals.🔽Seeing the danger in sensual desires,
seeing renunciation as safe,
I went forth in Rājagaha,
from home to the homeless life.
I know my past lives,
my divine eye is purified;
I have the knowledge of the minds of others,
and my clairaudience is purified.
I have realized psychic powers,
I have attained the destruction of the pollutants;
I have realized the six higher knowledges,
I have done what the Awakened One said.
Having magically created
a four-spoked chariot,
I bowed down at the feet of the Buddha,
the Tathāgata, the protector of the world.”
“Having gone to a tree in full bloom,
you stand alone at the foot of a sāla tree.

original: Na cāpi te dutiyo atthi koci,
analyzed: na ca api te dutiyaḥ atthi koci
translated: And you have no second at all,
You are not afraid of the ascetics, fool.”
“Even if a hundred thousand ascetics like you

original: Samāgatā edisakā bhaveyyuṁ;🔽Lomaṁ na iñje napi sampavedhe,
analyzed: samāgatāḥ edisakāḥ bhaveyyu  lomam naḥ iñje napi sampavedhe
translated: Were to come together,🔽My hair would not stand on end, nor would I tremble.
What can you do to me, Mara?
I will disappear,
or I will enter your belly;
I will stand in the middle of your face,
and you will not see me standing there.
I have mastery over my mind,
and I have well developed the bases of spiritual power.
I have realized the six kinds of direct knowledge.
I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.
Sensual pleasures are like a sword and a stake;
the aggregates are a chopping block.
What you call sensual pleasure,
I now have aversion to.
Everywhere delight has been destroyed,
and the mass of darkness has been shattered.
Know this, O Evil One:
You are defeated, O Death!”
… the nun Uppalavaṇṇā …
The twelfth collection is finished.
